Abstract
A bipartite graph G=(A,B,E)ùê∫ùê¥ùêµùê∏G=(A,B,E) is ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\cal H}-convex, for some family of graphs ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\cal H}, if there exists a graph H‚àà‚Ñãùêª‚ÑãH\in{\cal H} with V‚Äã(H)=Aùëâùêªùê¥V(H)=A such that the set of neighbours in Aùê¥A of each b‚ààBùëèùêµb\in B induces a connected subgraph of¬†HùêªH.
Many ùñ≠ùñØùñ≠ùñØ\mathsf{NP}-complete problems, including problems such as Dominating Set, Feedback Vertex Set, Induced Matching and List kùëòk-Colouring,
become polynomial-time solvable for ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}}-convex graphs when ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}} is the set of paths. In this case, the class of ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}}-convex graphs is known as the class of convex graphs. The underlying reason is that the class of convex graphs
has bounded mim-width. We extend the latter result to families of ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}}-convex graphs where (i) ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}} is the set of cycles, or (ii) ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}} is the set of trees with bounded maximum degree and a bounded number of vertices of degree at least¬†333.
As a consequence, we can strengthen a large number of results on generalized convex graphs known in the literature via one general and relatively short proof.
To complement result (ii), we show that the mim-width of ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}}-convex graphs is unbounded if ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\mathcal{H}} is the set of trees with arbitrarily large maximum degree or an arbitrarily large number of vertices of degree at least¬†333.
In this way we are able to determine complexity dichotomies for the aforementioned graph problems.
We prove our results via a more refined width-parameter analysis. This yields an even clearer picture of
which width parameters are bounded for classes of ‚Ñã‚Ñã{\cal H}-convex graphs.
